A blockchain is a distributed ledger that securely records and verifies transactions or data. It is decentralized in nature where information is recorded and stored in blocks which are interlinked using cryptography, thus forming a chain. The infrastructure makes it cumbersome to alter or hack the data, which strengthens transparency and security.
The current market price of Solana is:

Proof-Of-Stake, or POS, is a consensus mechanism used in blockchain technology to validate transactions and add new blocks to the chain. Contrary to Proof-Of-Work, POS selects validators based upon the amount of cryptocurrency they possess and are willing to 'stake', or lock away as collateral. The stake is intended to act as an incentive so validators will maintain network integrity and act in an honest manner.

Proof-Of-Work, or POW, is a consensus mechanism used in cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin to validate transactions and add new blocks to the blockchain. Proof-Of-Work requires participants (miners) to solve complex computational problems before their transactions are added to the blockchain. This process, otherwise referred to as mining, makes it computationally expensive and energy-intensive to tamper with the blockchain, which provides a secure and decentralized way to verify transactions.
